Position Summary:
Reporting directly to the VP, Information Technology, the Software Engineer III will be responsible for supporting Narus Health’s technology development initiatives – both in internal facing and external facing products as outlined below.
Duties and Responsibilities:
The following reflects the essential functions for this job but does not restrict the tasks that may be assigned. Management may assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time due to reasonable accommodation or other reasons.
The Software Engineer III is responsible for evaluating and building forward thinking technology solutions that allow Narus Health to deliver best-in-class care management services. Primary duties and responsibilities include:
· Defines business case objectives by analyzing user requirements; envisioning system features and functionality.
· Designs and develops user interfaces to enterprise applications by setting expectations and features priorities throughout development life cycle; determining design methodologies and tool sets; completing programming using languages and software products; designing and conducting tests.
· Recommends system solutions by comparing advantages and disadvantages of custom development and purchase alternatives.
· Integrates applications by designing database architecture and server scripting; studying and establishing connectivity with network systems, search engines, and information servers.
· Completes applications development by coordinating requirements, schedules, and activities; contributing to team meetings; troubleshooting development and production problems across multiple environments and operating platforms.
· Supports users by developing documentation and assistance tools.
· Explain technologies and solutions to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
· Keep up to date on the latest industry trends in software development.
· Other duties as requested.

Engineering at Postmates
We’re building groundbreaking tech solutions that power our revolutionary logistics platform to help connect millions of customers with their favorite merchants every day. We’re tackling some of the most complex technical challenges in the modern logistics space to unlock opportunities that positively impact the local businesses and communities we serve.
WHAT WE DO
Postmates relies heavily on our engineering team to realize this vision. Building a software platform that is reliable, scales, and stays agile under demanding product needs is a serious technical challenge. Postmates is a three-part balancing act connecting customers, merchants, and couriers in real-time. If any piece is out of whack, the whole system suffers. Working with the Postmates engineering team offers an opportunity with explosive growth, cutting-edge technology, a highly visible charter, and a cool user-focused product vision.
Android Engineers will work on 3 Android apps here at Postmates: the Buyer, Fleet, and Merchant apps. Engineers have high impact and are relied upon to own end-to-end deployment/support of our applications. Ideal candidates should have developed several native Android applications with complex functionality and significant user bases. Bonus points if you've worked with Kotlin, Jetpack Architecture Components, RxJava, Retrofit, or Dagger. Experience with Go, Python, or Google Protocol Buffers is a plus. Check out some of our open source work here and here!
YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
Write clean, robust, modularized code to build product and engineering features
Create and maintain testing infrastructure for unit & automated UI tests
Improve product quality through code reviews and adopting best practices
Be a thoughtful leader by researching and evangelizing emerging mobile technologies and sharing that knowledge with colleagues
Manage releases - creating builds, working with QA, fixing bugs, and monitoring the release
Build prototypes to quickly demonstrate new features and product ideas
OUR REQUIREMENTS
Minimum of 3 years of experience in building mobile applications
Experience developing and shipping one or more Android apps on Google Play
Deep understanding of Java and the Android SDK
Ability to get things done and work in an area outside of your comfort zone
Excellent communication skills with both technical and non-technical audiences
Strong sense of ownership and drive
Sharp problem-solving skills and ability to resolve ambiguous requirements
Bachelor's degree or experience equivalent
OUR PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience developing mobile applications that serve millions of users
Experience developing and optimizing top-notch UI
Experience instrumenting and optimizing performance
A bit about us
Postmates is changing delivery for good. While you may know us as the clever brand loved by celebrities and millennials, we are so much more. We are industry-first leaders in the modern logistics space, creating groundbreaking tech products that positively impact millions of customers, merchants and gig-economy workers as well as the underserved in the communities where we work. How will you help us change delivery for good?

Postmates has your back. In our impact-first work environment, we value huge company vision. Company Overview
Here at Hidrate we design and develop Bluetooth enabled smart water bottles that automatically track your water intake, sync to a personalized hydration app, and glow to remind you to stay healthy and hydrated.
Hidrate was established in 2014 by a founding team of recent University of Minnesota graduates. The team successfully flew through startup events, accelerators and crowdfunding that helped catapult the HidrateSpark water bottle line into the beverageware and health awareness markets, with placement in large retailers like Target, Apple Stores and online at Amazon.com.
Our team currently consists of roughly 20 full-time employees with 2 main office locations in Minneapolis and Chicago, while most of the manufacturing for the physical product is being done in China.
We are looking for detail oriented, organized, and hardworking individuals who are excited to grow along with the company. This individual will work closely with the company’s Engineering Department as a backend engineer. At Hidrate you'll be working with the rest of the engineering team to improve and maintain our software products. With likely business shifts in a fast-growing company, our processes continuously evolve. We are looking for an individual who will enjoy problem solving and adapting along with the business.
Job description
Improve and maintain a highly available Parse Server based backend in Node.js for our mobile app users.
Improve and maintain serverless Node.js functions used by our applications.
Improve and maintain the Express.js based API for our web portal.
Work with the engineering team on designing and scaling database structure.
New feature development.
Adding and improving automated testing coverage.
Required Skills
Experience with Node.js, Express.js, and MongoDB.
Experience with unit testing and automated integration testing JavaScript.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field (or equivalent experience).
Understanding of system architecture optimized for heavy traffic.
Experience with Parse Server and the Serverless framework highly desirable but not required.
At least 3+ years of Backend Engineer experience
Compensation
Salary is commensurate with experience
Health benefits
Flexible work schedule and accommodations (e.g. work from home, telework)
Unlimited PTO
Opportunity for performance-based bonuses and company stock incentives

You are a Software Engineer with solid understanding of algorithms and data structures, compiler design, and object oriented programming. You are looking for difficult challenges, the possibility of great innovations, and abundant opportunities for technical research, continuous learning, and skill development.
We are Peddinghaus Corporation’s Advanced Software Development department, a highly collaborative team that creates result-oriented software and strives to enable our customers’ to safely achieve optimal productivity. Peddinghaus Corporation is the leading equipment manufacturer for structural steel fabricators.
Our software interfaces between structural engineering and our customers’ machines that process structural steel beams and columns before they are assembled on construction sites into stadiums, skyscrapers, hospitals, bridges, and other structures. Our software comprises a wide range of technological opportunities, including a core 3D geometry engine, compiler-like post processors to generate CNC code, NP complete algorithms, SQL databases, file parsers with data mapping, interfaces to structural design software, and graphic user interfaces. We utilize C# and both Windows Forms and ASP.NET MVC.
We like you to join us at our Chicago, IL office near Union Station, or at our Bradley, IL headquarters.
Your key characteristics:
Fascinated by the opportunity to advance software development for an equipment manufacturer for structural steel fabricators.
Communication skills for collaboration with other engineering disciplines.
Strong interpersonal, analytical, problem solving, and organizational skills.
Bachelor’s or postgraduate degree in CS/CE/EE or related field.
3 years’ or otherwise commensurate experience in analytical software design and development.
Thorough understanding of algorithms and data structures, compiler design, and OOP principles.
Deep knowledge of C#, Windows Forms, ASP.NET MVC, and Microsoft Visual Studio.
Leverage software development methods and technologies including SDLC concepts.
Familiarity with relational databases and SQL.
Technical skills or areas of understanding include:
Programming language design
Discrete structures
Combinatorial mathematics
Approximation algorithms
Parallel numerical algorithms
NP complete problems
Formal Software Development Methods
Formal Models of Computation
Computational Complexity
If you are an experienced Software Engineer fascinated by the opportunity to advance software development for an equipment manufacturer for structural steel fabricators, if you are eager to solve challenging problems with impacts in the physical world, if you thrive on cross-disciplinary collaboration, then apply for this position.
Work location options:
Our Chicago, IL software development office is across the river from Union Station next to the Chicago Riverwalk. The loop is only a couple of blocks away and most of Chicago’s amenities are within walking distance.
Our Bradley, IL headquarters are about an hour’s drive south of Chicago. Bradley and its surrounding communities offer a variety of suburban and rural living within easy commuting distance. After COVID-19 restrictions have been lifted it is expected that all corporate amenities will be available again, especially our gym with indoor tennis and basketball court, as well as, our gourmet cafeteria. In Bradley you are close to C-Level leaders, Engineering, Manufacturing, Sales, Service, and our Software Support team.
Because of Covid-19, we are currently working 2 days in the office, 3 days from our home offices. The Chicago and Bradley offices are accessible 24/7.
Peddinghaus participates in E-Verify.

Since 1923, NCCI has been committed to fostering a healthy workers compensation system. We are the nation's trusted source for accurate, objective workers compensation information. Learn about how you can contribute to our company's success in the following position:

WHAT YOU WILL DO IN THIS POSITION:
Responsible for developing and executing test strategies/plans and automated test scripts to ensure delivery of quality information systems and/or software programs of moderate complexity that conform to organization standards and user requirements. Works with project teams to develop test strategies/plans and automated test scripts, ensuring the appropriate level of testing is performed. Serves as subject matter expert on testing applications/software for assigned areas.

Develops automated test scripts, performs tests and evaluates/validates test results including functional e2e testing, regression testing, systems testing, customer acceptance testing and stress/performance testing for moderately complex applications/systems. Coordinates Customer testing. Manages defects and issues identified during testing through resolution.

Develops test strategies/plans and test scenarios/cases based on documentation and standards for moderately complex applications/systems. Facilitates development of test approach with project team.

Participates in reviews/stand-ups of Product Backlog/Sprints/Business Requirements, and application/system design documents for moderately complex applications/systems. Gains understanding of business functions/applications/activities pertinent to the project/change request.

Establishes the technical configuration for testing, including all environmental components, data, automated test scripts and security. Coordinates migrations into the QA environment.

WHAT YOU MUST BRING TO THE ROLE:
A Bachelor’s degree in computer information or related field and a minimum of 3 years of experience in Quality Assurance and/or application development, automated application/software testing or software/test engineering; in lieu of a bachelor’s degree, additional work experience and/or trade school or applicable certifications required.

Working knowledge of an Information Technology environment, including using and testing applications/systems, employing software development and testing methodologies (SCRUM), change management, project management and information security practices.

Strong Interpersonal Skills: Verbal, written, teaming and collaborating with business and IT partners.
Solid analytical and detail-oriented skills for the development of test strategies/plans, automated test scripts and test cases.

Experience with the following technologies and tools:
Testing tools/frameworks: Protractor, Jasmine, Cucumber/Gherkin, SoapUI, Test Café, Cypress IO, Jest, OpenScript
Databases: MariaDB, MongoDB, Oracle, SQL Server; logical database design (relational), relational database retrieval tools
Scripting/Programming languages: JavaScript, Unix shell scripting, SQL
Pipeline automation/Source Code Repositories: Git, Gitlab, Jenkins
Software architectures: .NET, Angular, React, Go
Virtualization: Docker containers and Kubernetes
Markup languages: CSS, HTML and XML
WHAT WILL MAKE YOU A MORE VIABLE CANDIDATE:
Application development background.
Expertise in more than one testing tool (newer tools preferred e.g. Test Café and/or Cypress)
Having the QA mindset (inquisitive nature).
Constant desire to learn.
WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU:
A competitive starting base salary plus a targeted annual performance bonus
A phenomenal work environment, with perks including onsite restaurant and coffee shop, employee activities, onsite fitness center, and sports leagues
A wonderful team of dynamic people to work with who are fun, caring and friendly
A fantastic benefits package that's hard to find in South Florida

We are the industry leader. At NCCI, we recognize that our employees are the reason our legacy endures today. Position Title: VM Software Engineer (VMSE)
Company: Savant Automation
Reports to: Project Implementation Manager
General function and primary objective:
This mid-level engineering position is responsible for developing Vehicle Manager (VM) software that directs Automatic Guided Vehicle (AGV) systems, by architecting, designing, and developing appropriate software solutions.
Under the direction of the supervisor and mentor(s), the person in this position gathers requirements, designs, codes, tests, commissions, and documents software for the design, control, monitoring, and analysis of AGV systems. The individual will function in a team environment working with peers on software applications, modules, libraries, and other components. The software developed by the person in this position may be driven by product or customer project needs, as needed. This is a professional position in which the person is required to exercise independent judgment and to work under a minimum of supervision.
Additionally, as a mid-level engineering position, the person in this position may be expected to participate in system design & architecture activities, participate in business/product/project planning activities, assist in the Agile planning/management software activities, and set the tone for a healthy and effective team environment.
The position may require occasional travel for customer site visits and professional improvement opportunities.
The VMSE primary duties are:
Collaborate with peers in cross-functional discussions to support system design and understanding.
Determines operational feasibility by evaluating analysis, problem definition, requirements, solution development, and proposed solutions.
Documents and demonstrates solutions by developing documentation, flowcharts, layouts, diagrams, charts, code comments and clear code.
Prepares complete solutions by determining and designing system specifications, standards, and programming.
Participate in full software product life cycle support.
Improves operations by conducting systems analysis; recommending changes in policies and procedures.
Updates job knowledge by studying state-of-the-art development tools, programming techniques, and computing equipment; participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations.
Protects operations by keeping information confidential.
Provides information by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing development and service issues.
Accomplishes engineering and organization mission by completing related tasks as needed.
Develops software solutions by studying information needs; conferring with users; studying systems flow, data usage, and work processes; investigating problem areas; following the software development lifecycle.
Assist other engineering groups by participating in problem report investigation and analysis, as well as conferring with customers or on-site personnel regarding problem reports.
Participates in the weekly development status meetings, etc.
Qualifications / Skills:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each primary duty satisfactorily. The assigned individual should possess a technical background in the required technologies and the ability to learn to lead the various Savant engineers and work with customer personnel. The VMSE must have improving written and verbal communication, team building and interpersonal skills. Experience in AGV or autonomous vehicle systems is preferred.
Education / Experience:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent, along with 2+ years of experience in desktop application development.
Experience in developing desktop applications in C, C++ and C# is required. Experience or familiarity in services development, SQL database development, vehicle simulation, XML, web technologies, IP networking technologies, and Scrum/Agile software development is a plus.
Other skills / abilities:
Experience and skill using MS Visual Studio (2013+), compilers, build environments, debuggers, network logging/analysis tools, Wi-Fi & general networking equipment, Word and Outlook are essential.
Company Overview
Savant Automation is a leader in one of the fastest growing high-tech areas of industrial automation, providing AGVS (Automatic Guided Vehicle Systems) for material handling and assembly operations in factories, warehouses and hospitals.
We are a rarity in our field …... we develop and own our advanced technology, we manufacture our own robotic vehicles, install the systems and provide all aftermarket support.
With a 60 year history, we have many customers including Ford, Cummins, Sears, Toyota, Honda, Daimler, Newell Rubbermaid, Alcoa, Whirlpool, Kaiser, Invista, Rexam, Ropak, John Deere, Carrier, Lagunitas Brewing, Consolidated Container, Karmax/Decostar and Walgreens, just to name a few.
Savant Automation’s large and diverse Customer base demonstrates the wide range of applications our vehicle designs and technology supports. We supply standalone and integrated AGV systems.
Our control architecture Support one or hundreds of self-guided vehicles safely operating on a ‘virtual’ path of unlimited length in large and small facilities. Our systems incorporate many state-of-the-art technologies including Wi-Fi, Algorithmic-driven system management and vehicle control software, network interfaces, advance vehicle inertial navigation controls, and embedded machine control logic utilizing a variety of integrated sensors.
Visit our website www.agvsystems.com for more information.

• Performs additional duties and special projects as assigned. Overview


SmartNews is a leading mobile app of news aggregation services. We analyze millions of articles to deliver the most engaging information with high quality, in near-real time fashion, to millions of users around the world. We are looking for talented backend engineers to help us build user growth and engagement related features in the US market. Together, we are working to break through the filter bubble and deliver the best quality information to our end users.

Responsibilities
Design and implement scalable backend solutions (client-server protocols, business logic, database layer, etc) end to end for user facing features
Identify bottlenecks and apply optimizations in complex distributed systems
Collaborate cross functionally with mobile, frontend, machine learning engineers and product managers to communicate challenges and define milestones
Provide thoughtful code reviews and technical insights to multiply team productivity
Requirements

Minimum Requirements
3+ years of experience working on backend development in large scale distributed system
Hands on coding experience that delivers scalable and fault tolerant components with test strategy in mind
Experience solving complex problems with other engineers and business stakeholders in backend environment and drive the progress of execution to the finish line
Ability to guide and onboard junior engineers on technical side
Expert coding abilities in multiple programming languages (e.g. Java, C++, Python, Golang)
MS or BS in computer science, mathematics, physics or other quantitative fields|
Preferred Requirements
Proficient coding skills in Java and familiar with Java frameworks
Experience with public cloud technologies like AWS, GCP, Azure, etc
Experience working with user growth and engagement related projects in large scale
Strong interest in news media and our mission to deliver high quality information to the world

Job Description:


At Fidelity Labs, we dont accept the status quo. Were debating, experimenting, researching, teaching, and collaborating on new ideas to help people live better financial lives. We have dedicated cross-functional incubator teams that operate like startups but have the backing and resources of Fidelity to ensure that we are able to focus on the things that matter. Using a combination of good old-fashioned ingenuity, and innovation methodologies such as Design Thinking and Lean Startup, our incubators take a customer-centric approach to problem solving, with a focus on rapid experimentation, and the permission to fail. See what were up to at FidelityLabs.com

Our software engineers play a key role on our incubator teams, making the ideas we research and refine through user testing come to life by building prototypes and iteratively evolving them into scalable products. Our incubator teams are empowered to move quickly and operate independently, so our engineers are involved in every step of the process from design through deployment. We believe strongly that it is our responsibility to continuously improve both as engineers and as a team every iteration so we write automated tests as part of our development workflow, practice pair programming, perform peer code reviews, and share knowledge in weekly tech talks. We use modern technologies and are always open to improving our tools and our process. The role is based in Durham, NC.

The Expertise Were Looking For
Bachelors degree Computer Science or other related discipline
Rapidly develop enterprise software based on requirement documents, prototypes, or verbal requirements
Learn and adopt new concepts & technologies quickly and implement them effectively in projects
Work across peer groups to resolve and understand complex technical/design issues.
Talent for writing clean, testable, readable, and easily maintainable code
Experience with middleware Java stack, Spring, messaging technologies and web containers
Experience with client side tech stack: HTML, CSS/SCSS, JavaScript, and Angular
Experience working in an Agile software delivery environment, with exposure to continuous integration and continuous delivery tools.
Understanding of fundamental design principles for building a scalable application
The Purpose of Your Role

Our software engineers play a key role on our incubator teams, making the ideas we research and refine through user testing come to life by building prototypes and iteratively evolving them into scalable products. Our incubator teams are empowered to move quickly and operate independently, so our engineers are involved in every step of the process from design through deployment. We believe strongly that it is our responsibility to continuously improve both as engineers and as a team every iteration so we write automated tests as part of our development workflow, practice pair programming, perform peer code reviews, and share knowledge in weekly tech talks. We use modern technologies and are always open to improving our tools and our process.

The Skills You Bring
We are looking for software engineers that are able to build high-quality, test-driven applications
Someone with deep knowledge of IT concepts, strategies, methodologies, and their application to business opportunities.
A proven track record of designing and building end-to-end systems client/server/db
Excellent knowledge of JavaScript, node, Express, Angular and Java although were open to strong developers with experience in other languages or frameworks and a desire to learn.
Expertise in various relational and no SQL database technologies
Someone who writes clean, maintainable code and refactors and improves the codebase as they add features to it
Experience being a mentor and builder of nimble and passionate teams.
Comfortable dealing with ambiguity and change
How Your Work Impacts the Organization

Fidelity Labs mission is to improve the financial lives of customers. Our approach is to identify important jobs to be done and then create business models that do them better than any other alternative. We are constantly scanning for ways to help customers. We then incubate those ideas from concept to scale. Fidelity Labs currently has a number of ventures at various stages in the pipeline - from deeply understanding the customers job to be done, to designing and experimenting to find product/market fit to pilot and scaling. The goal is to create sustainable new businesses that directly improve our customers financial lives.

Company Overview

At Fidelity, we are focused on making our financial expertise broadly accessible and effective in helping people live the lives they want. We are a privately held company that places a high degree of value in creating and nurturing a work environment that attracts the best talent and reflects our commitment to our associates. For information about working at Fidelity, visit FidelityCareers.com.

This opportunity is brought to you by Fidelity Labs.

Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer.

About Osmose
With 85 years of experience, Osmose proudly serves the electric utility and telecommunications industries across the U.S., helping enable the delivery of safe, reliable and affordable electricity and communications services to millions of customers nationwide. We are the industry leader in wood and steel structure condition assessment, life-extension and rehabilitation services. Our mission is to accurately inspect and mitigate aging infrastructure in a planned, programmatic manner that minimizes owner costs while maximizing benefits.
Headquartered in Peachtree City, Georgia, with satellite offices in Atlanta, Buffalo-Depew, Syracuse, Boston-Westborough and Secaucus, NJ, the Osmose footprint extends throughout the country. Our employees are inspired to perform each and every day by our core values of integrity, customer focus, safety, respect, excellence, flexibility, efficiency and ownership. Our staff and field personnel represent some of the most tenured, well trained, and innovative professionals in the industry.
We are currently seeking a Software Engineer who will work closely with the Product Manager and development/test team to develop enhanced features based on structural engineering standards to an established structural analysis software product. The primary goal is to grow the product as the leading package into other market segments in the electric and communication utilities space and to grow the Technical Services profit center using the company's structural analysis software package.
This position can be based at our office in Syracuse, NY or from a home office if willing to travel to company facilities (primarily Syracuse) on a regular basis.
Responsibilities
Partner with the Software Development team to implement (design, write, debug, test, and document) new product functionality based on defined national and international structural analysis standards.
Develop expertise and serve as subject matter expert i the electric and communication utility structural analysis, design and maintenance including the strength and load aspect of wood, steel, concrete and fiberglass structures.
Develop expertise and serve as subject matter expert in national and international structural analysis standards as it relates to the electric and communication utility industry.
Work with the Product Manager, Software Development Team, and other internal teams (Engineering, Operations, etc.) to implement functionality that gives Osmose an advantage in our structural engineering and technical services.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or related engineering field with two (2) years of related experience preferred.
Excellent written and oral communication skills. Must be able to write technical documents using proper style and grammar.
Required knowledge of C# and SQL with demonstrated project experience utilizing these technologies. Experience in reporting and data presentation.
Strong working knowledge of structure engineering, physics and math disciplines.
Experience with national/international structure analysis standards a plus.
Experience in the utility industry is desirable.
Willingness to travel to Syracuse, NY and Peachtree City, GA office locations on a regular basis (25%) and customer, vendor, and industry meeting locations, as needed.
Benefits
Come grow with us! Full-time employees enjoy a comprehensive benefits package that includes:
Medical Insurance and Health Savings Account with company contribution
Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, STD, LTD, Critical Illness Plan and more!
401(k) with excellent company match
Paid time off

About SugarCRM, Inc.
SugarCRM is a customer experience (CX) leader enabling businesses to create profitable customer relationships by delivering highly relevant, personalized experiences throughout the customer journey. We empower companies to strengthen existing customer relationships, create new ones through actionable insights and intelligent automation and better understand the customer at every stage of the journey. This enables businesses to accelerate demand generation, grow revenue, deliver superior customer care and increase loyalty. Our easy-to-use, intuitive platform makes customer experience easy and accessible for everyone, allowing marketing, sales and services professionals to focus on high-impact, value-adding activities that create customers for life.

Where do you fit?
As a Frontend Engineer you will play a critical hands-on role responsible for managing execution related to the design, development and delivery of our next generation user interface and experience. This role requires someone with significant experience with Javascript frameworks (e.g. Angular or Bootstrap) that has worked with web-based applications.

Impact you will make in the role:
Develop, configure, debug, secure, and deploy high performance web applications. Code, test, debug, implement, document, and develop programs
Participate in functional requirements and design documentation. Work closely with the Product and UX team to iterate designs, shaping.
UI requirements: Perform quality testing in collaboration with Quality Assurance staff to identify and correct defects. Analyze existing code base and identify opportunities for performance improvements through re-factoring and/or re-design. Well-organized and process driven to ensure effective delivery.

What you will need to succeed:
2+ years with the following technologies: JQuery, Angular8, Bootstrap, or similar. 2+ years front-end development skills (HTML/CSS/JavaScript). Successful track record producing web applications and working with RESTful web services. Familiar with Agile or other rapid application development methods. Ability to effectively interpret technical and business objectives and to articulate solutions. Ability to think abstractly and deal with problems. Willingness to roll up your sleeves and help the team be successful. Highly organized with excellent communication skills. Four year university/college degree required - preferably in Computer Science (or related).

Bonus if you have:
Proficiency with .NET, Java, or Python
Knowledge of Google’s Material Design principles or other usability practices
A strong sense of aesthetic and design
Experience with marketing applications (email marketing, landing page & nurture design)
Software as a Service platform experience
Experience with the RESTful/ HATEOAS style of SOA

Location: Atlanta, GA

Engineering Team Culture:
Our focus is building out teams with smart engineers who are passionate about their craft and excited to build software for our unique solutions in the CRM (customer relationship management) space. At SugarCRM, you'll have the chance to work on various teams and stacks. Here's more:
Communication and collaboration is key to our processes, and we don't want to hinder it with walls.
We are passionate about automated testing to deliver a high level of quality to our customers.
We use a Scrum-based development methodology that includes daily stand-ups, regular Sprint reviews, and retrospectives to discuss. We value unique perspectives brought by diverse backgrounds and experiences. A broad range of ideas and perspectives help us to create the best possible product.
As a part of our company culture, we encourage everyone to work at a healthy, sustainable pace.
We understand that no candidate is perfectly qualified for any job. Experience comes in different forms; many skills are transferable; and passion goes a long way. Even more important than your resume is a clear demonstration of dedication, impact, and the ability to thrive in a fluid and collaborative environment. We want you to learn new things in this role, and we encourage you to apply if your experience is close to what we’re looking for. We also know that diversity of background and thought makes for better problem solving and more creative thinking, which is why we're dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team.
Benefits and Perks:
Beyond a stellar work environment, friendly people, and inspiring work, we have some great benefits and perks:

- Excellent medical, dental and vision coverage for you and your family, along with other benefit plans including 401(k) match
- Unlimited Paid Time Off
- Wellness Reimbursement Program
- Onsite Programs, depending on location, such as Dry Cleaning, Car Washes, Massage, Yoga, and more
- Career & Personal Development Program – multi-platform
- Regular social events
- Ownership is the greatest self-identity at SugarCRM - you are making an immediate impact
- We are a merit-based company - many opportunities to learn, excel and grow your career

Job Title: Software Engineer - Mission-Focused Integration (TS/SCI with Polygraph)
Job Description:
We're looking for game changers. People who love what they do and who they do it for. Providing consulting services in operational support, intelligence collection, reporting, and data governance, R2C is a leader in delivering solutions for high priority national security concerns. Are you ready for a change?

R2C is seeking Software Engineers to support a client's technical requirements on a mission-focused program within a challenging, dynamic setting located in the Washington Metropolitan Area.
We welcome the most challenging problems facing our national security and apply intellect, talent, and innovation to reach feasible and valuable solutions to each challenge. That means we expect our employees to bring their “A game,” and you have the right to expect the same from the company that employs you. We want to hear your ideas. We want to hear your concerns. We want to make sure you have what you need to do the best you can on the job and grow in your career with us over time. Almost all companies say they have a culture of inclusiveness and that they value employee input, but R2C puts that statement to work every day. It’s time for a change. Come and experience a company that actually cares.

Top Secret/SCI w/ Polygraph
Design, develop, test, and deploy COTS and custom components for systems
Assist in the installation, deployment, and maintenance of the COTS product
Perform configuration changes as needed
Interface with infrastructure teams during upgrades or troubleshooting
Support development and integration of new digital policies
Interface with customers for digital policy creation, policy ingestion, policy integration, and testing
Support implementation of an automated unit and integration testing capability for access control policies and other service components using Junit
Assist in creation of technical documentation
Support end user training on the creation and management of access control policies
Take customer requirements for enhancing custom web applications
Support the development of new digital policies
Interface with customers during digital policy creation, policy ingestion, policy integration, and testing

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, or similar discipline
Must have an Active TS/SCI clearance with Polygraph
Experience developing, testing, deploying, and maintaining complex application programming interfaces
Experience designing, programming, testing, and delivering custom web applications in Java
Experience with development and integration with COTS applications in a virtual environment
Experience developing and deploying web-based applications on Tomcat and familiarity with JavaScript frameworks
Experience designing, configuring, performing, and evaluating results of back-end, service-based automated testing
Experience writing, testing, deploying, and maintaining complex LINUX shell scripts in a cloud-based, DevOps style environment
Experience with at least one scripting language
Willingness to learn digital policy authoring languages and skills including working with JavaScript, XACML, and COTS digital policy tools
Experience with Amazon Web Services
Rudimentary knowledge of Linux and shell scripting
Experience performing functional, integration, and unit testing
Experience with DevOps, automation and configuration management using tools such as Ansible
Experience with Puppet, Jenkins, and Github
Experience developing RESTful web services with JSON
Experience delivering enterprise level Identity and Access Management services
Experience with SQL, or willingness and ability to learn on basic SQL on the job
Experience developing within an Agile team environment
Experience with Certificate Management (x509)
Experience with overall troubleshooting and debugging in a production environment
Experience with all aspects of workflow tools to include: tool selection, design, implementation, integration, workflow and process design, workflow optimization, and workflow metrics
Experience with risk management to include identifying, citing, ranking, and establishment of appropriate mitigation approaches
Experience with the data management lifecycle, governance, and best practices
The Reports and Requirements Company, LLC (R2C) is a wholly owned subsidiary of Buchanan & Edwards, and provides consulting services in operational support, intelligence collection, reporting, and data governance. Located in Arlington, VA, R2C offers expertise on a variety of national security topics, with specific focus on operational support, technical operations, policies and management of large volumes of data, analysis of large amounts of data, & effective approaches to evaluating and sharing data, and innovative techniques for information collection. Our consultants develop and deliver training programs on subjects including cyber intelligence, data governance and information sharing protocols, intelligence collection, and reporting techniques. R2C has a mission first culture and boasts the benefits & perks of a small company with the resources, stability, and career mobility of a large corporation. R2C is dedicated to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of diversity and inclusion. We are committed to crafting a workplace that endorses creativity and innovation, and promotes engagement through open communication, acceptance of new people and ideas, and a supportive team dynamic. R2C is an equal Opportunity Employer – Minorities / Women / Veterans / Individuals with Disabilities / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.

Job Title: Back End Software Engineer - Core Platform
Job Description:
GET TO KNOW US

We are on a mission to defeat inactivity! Gympass is a discovery platform that empowers companies to engage their workforce in physical activity by providing access to the largest global network of workout facilities. With a single monthly membership, companies can help employees find their perfect fit among 800 different activities at over 50,000 fitness facilities across the US, Europe, and Latin America. We increase the number of people exercising every day, helping them to become active and reach their goals. Let's help people get there together!

WHAT MAKES A GYMPASSER?

We are passionate about our mission! Whatever your job title is, here you can make a global impact and change people's lives. At Gympass, we collaborate, set high achievable goal expectations and focus on the end result. It's a challenging, evolving environment that allows you to learn and grow. You will face a disruptive and emerging business model that will push you in several areas, with no boundaries for creation and collaboration.


THE OPPORTUNITY - Back End Software Engineer


e are hiring a Back End Software Engineer to our Core team in Lisbon - Portugal

YOUR IMPACT
Ensure successful delivery of projects, and promote the long-term technical health of our services.
Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve services focusing on performance, scalability and stability.
Build Integration with 3rd party API and tools.
Bring expertise in architecture and design process, dive into the most complex technical problems.
Support existing systems looking to enhance functionality, increase scale, and transform in new ways to meet our product demands.
Create new services and capabilities to meet emerging needs as our business grows.
Build scalable, maintainable architectures, and to write clean and readable code.
Work in agile development and quick prototypes, and you strive to see your work in action.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
4+ years of experience designing and developing complex modern web applications.
Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent professional experience.
Experience applying object-oriented or functional design and RESTful web services.
Experience applying computer science fundamentals: data structures, algorithm design, problem solving and complexity analysis.
Experience with at least one programming language such as Java, Scala, Python, Ruby or Go.
Experience with SQL technology such as PostgreSQL, MySQL.
Good communication skills.
Experience architecting large-scale multi-tier web applications.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience with NoSQL technology such as DynamoDB
Cloud-based architectures (AWS / GCP)
Proficient in a broad range of software design approaches and common UX patterns
Can articulate the risks and benefits of depending on front-end libraries, frameworks, and tool-sets
Willingness to mentor junior engineers
Experience architecting large-scale multi-tier web applications
WHAT WE OFFER YOU

We're a wellness company that is committed to the health and wellbeing of our employees. Our benefits include:

1) WELLNESS: health and dental insurance.

2) GYMPASS DISCOUNT: We believe in our mission and encourage our employees and their families to find their passion too.

3) CAREER GROWTH: Outstanding opportunities for personal and career growth. That means we maintain a growth mindset in everything we do and invest deeply in employee development.

4) CULTURE: An exciting and supportive atmosphere with ambitious people from around the world!

5) FLEXIBLE SCHEDULE: We give our employees some flexibility to adjust their working hours.

And to get a glimpse of Life at Gympass... Check out our new Instagram account! @gympasscareers

Gympass is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We don't discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

[Please apply via email. See below for application instructions.]
Why Inkbit might be great for you
We are a collaborative team of 20 people, passionate about creating the next-generation 3D printing platform. Inkbit’s technology is multi-disciplinary and exciting, combining artificial intelligence and machine learning with an industrial multimaterial 3D printing form factor to revolutionize manufacturing.
You would join a team that is small enough that you will know everyone else well, where you will collaborate closely to solve exciting, impactful problems in 3D printing, and where you will be surrounded by others who are great at what they do and who are supportive team-players. At Inkbit, you will grow professionally in a teamwork-centric environment and will make impactful contributions to the team and the next generation of 3D printing.
Our goal is to change the way people make things, enabling amazing new products that could never have been made before. We are seeing strong interest in our platform and are excited about fully commercializing the technology together with you.
What we are looking for in a Senior Software Engineer (Typescript/UI/C++)
You like that your work at Inkbit would be about a UI that connects to a real production machine and not to a purely digital product. Your knowledge designing and implementing functional and effective user interfaces will help you solve these exciting challenges. You will also frequently interact with members of Inkbit’s highly multidisciplinary team of engineers and scientists.
We are looking for someone who enjoys being part of a team that is both ambitious and collaborative:
You like the freedom of a small energetic startup environment
You are curious about new opportunities to learn and grow
You want to contribute to our positive team culture.
You enjoy working together with colleagues in Inkbit’s cross-disciplinary team.
You are curious about software problems and puzzles, and enjoy being in an environment where you can learn quickly and share your experience with others.
Your responsibilities will include:
Refine the product requirement specification together with the team
Design and implement a user experience for the creation of complex, multi-material parts
Participate in code reviews
Collaborate with other R&D staff on software development and strategy
Create and maintain software documentation
Be a key player on Inkbit’s software team as we roll out our first commercial products
Help guide more junior UI developers
Especially during the current pandemic, most of our developers are working remotely and you will have this option as well. It is not a strict requirement but would be beneficial if you are able to come to our office from time to time when needed.
Main Skills and Experience
Many great team members do not fit a “standard blueprint”. Even if you do not fit all aspects listed below, but feel that you can contribute to Inkbit’s team, please do not hesitate to apply or to reach out with questions.
Proficiency in Javascript/Typescript
Experience with React and Node.js
Familiarity with C++ programming
To Apply
Please send your resume via email to careers[at]inkbit3d.com; Subject: “Senior Software Engineer” and your name. Please either include a cover letter or a short paragraph in the email why you are excited about the position and why you think it could be a good fit.
We will ask about three references during our first call, but feel free to already include their contact information with your application. We will check with you before contacting any of your references.

SmartCOP Inc. is seeking a C# .NET Xamarin Software Engineer to develop a cross-platform Field Based Reporting app for law enforcement and conservation enforcement agencies.

This position is a short-term contract and is remote based.

What will be your impact:
The Software Engineer will work remotely as part of a team to design, develop, and implement a cross-platform (iOS/Android/Windows) Field Based Reporting app for law enforcement and conservation enforcement agencies, using C#, .NET, Xamarin, WPF, ASP.NET Core, Entity Framework Core, and SQL Server.
We are seeking smart, innovative candidates who can get things done.
We expect you to be proficient in the technology, language, and development environment needed for the project.
The successful candidate must be able to take draft functional requirements and actively participate in the design of the final functional requirements.
What we are looking for:
At least three years of mobile app development experience, meeting aggressive deadlines, and performing software development duties.
Excellent verbal, written communication, and customer service skills.
Strong problem solving and analytical capabilities. Ability to troubleshoot technical problems and perform (or identify) potential resolutions.
Outstanding coding skills backed by the ability to make good judgment calls.
Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, high volume, deadline-driven environment.
Ability to balance multiple demands and work both independently and as part of a team.
Must actively participate in development team code reviews.
Technical Requirements
Strong programming skills in C#.
Experience with object-oriented design and development principles within the .NET framework.
Experience with cross-platform development using Xamarin.iOS, Xamarin.Android, and Xamarin.Forms.
Experience with WPF.
Experience with ASP.NET Core and Entity Framework Core.
Experience interacting with MS SQL Server database, T-SQL, stored procedures.
Good working experience in n-tier web-based architecture / service-oriented architecture and design.
Experience developing and consuming web services.
Experience rewriting Windows desktop applications as mobile applications.
Experience with unit testing frameworks.
Experience with NoSQL databases.
What will make you stand out:
BS in Computer Science or closely related field or its equivalent combination of relevant education and experience.
Ability to collaborate and participate in meetings during regular work hours in the North American Central Time zone.
Applicants selected may be subject to government security background investigations in order to work with sensitive public safety information.
About us:

SmartCOP, Inc. is a public safety software business engaged in system development, implementation, and support services for a fully integrated suite of products including Computer Aided Dispatch (CAD), Records Management System (RMS), Mobile Computing with Field Based Reporting, and Jail Management System (JMS) for first responders in the law, fire, and EMS markets.

Riverside Research strives to be one of America’s premier providers of independent, trusted technical and scientific expertise. As we continue to add experienced, technically astute staff, we are looking for highly motivated, talented team members that can help our DoD and Intelligence Community (IC) customers continue delivery of world class programs. As a not-for-profit, technology-oriented Defense Company, we believe service to customers and support of our staff is our mission. Our goal is to serve as a destination company by providing an industry-leading, positive, and rewarding employee experience for all who join us. We aspire to be a valued partner to our customers and to earn their trust through our unwavering commitment to achieve timely, innovative, cost-effective and mission-focused solutions.

At Cisco Meraki, we know that technology can connect us, empower us, and drive us. By simplifying powerful technology, we can free passionate people to focus on their mission. As the fastest growing cloud-managed networking team in the world, our products, and technology architecture are changing the face of enterprise networking and making cloud-managed IT a reality.

Our San Francisco hardware team is seeking an Embedded Software/Diagnostics Engineer who will play a multifaceted role, connecting with Meraki’s Hardware and Software groups, and overseas JDM partners. They will be the driving force in communicating and directing sophisticated software assignments to the non-local teams.

Additionally, you’ll contribute to IoT and FPGA work, light security code bring-up and sequencing, and collaborating with Cisco’s security team. Your work will impact all of Meraki’s product lines -- including new additions -- and do so across our widespread JDM ecosystem.

Join our high-impact team and work with every part of the machine that brings the Meraki magic to market!

You will:
Work with firmware resources and incorporate feedback into the development plan
Test BSP/SDK to bring POCs and early samples to minimum functionality
Validate manufacturing functions in hardware
Collaborate with JDMs to outline block diagrams and schematics to ensure proper hardware designs are followed
Develop architecture, author PRDs, and lead RFQs for our new security portfolio
Validate and iterate on layout and schematics, and drive vendor approvals
Collaborate with Quality to build a testbed for firmware release qualification and validation
Develop Meraki drivers for custom circuitry for peripherals such as fans, sensors, and power supplies
Define and maintain firmware structural standard across Meraki platforms (memory mapping, RTL code, LED drivers, etc)
Define and implement or guide FPGA glue logic, reset/CLK logic, and compilation with trusted security technology
Collaborate with NPI teams; including ME, sourcing, packaging, certification, and quality; and provide technical mentorship as needed
Work both independently and cross-functionally to ensure timely deliverables.
You have:
BS and/or MS in Electrical Engineering or related discipline
Familiarity with memory architectures and characteristics such as EEPROM, SPI Flash, NAND, eMMC, DRAM, and SRAM
Soldering and board rework competency
Strong understanding of software and hardware interaction
Skilled with oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, bus analyzers, JTAG debuggers
Familiarity with bus protocols I2C, SPI, and UART
5+ years experience working with switches, routers and/or hardware products
Minimum 2 years of experience working with Asia-based manufacturers
Experience with C#, C++, C, Python and Assembly languages
Experience with CPUs (ARM and/or x86)
Multiple years of experience interacting with human beings
Ability to travel up to 25% to Taiwan and China
Nice to have:
Expertise in Layer 2 and Layer 3 switching
Familiarity with manufacturing processes and build management
IoT experience including sensor development
Cultural competency and understanding of Taiwanese and Chinese cultures
At Cisco Meraki, we don't just accept differences - it's one of our key values. Everybody In means we listen to each other's opinions. Everybody is accepted and valued here, and we are a team that works as one towards our goals. We recognize that diverse teams make the strongest teams, and we encourage people from all backgrounds to apply.

Meraki is based in the Mission Bay area of San Francisco, with beautiful views of the Oracle Ballpark and the Bay beyond. You will have access to an onsite gym, multiple kitchens stocked with high-quality snacks, a coffee bar, catered lunches every day, and a generous benefits package.

Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis. As a Software Engineer on the Service Provider Network Automation Applications team, you will develop our next generation cloud-ready network automation application called Cisco Crosswork. You are curious about and have been involved in the development of various application systems for the networking industry, demonstrate strong software development skills.

Who You'll Work For

You will work for a dynamic team of Engineers within the Cisco Service Provider Engineer team that is developing our next generation of applications for our Network Automation, Network Optimization Engine products utilized by large Service Providers.

Who You Are

You have 6+ years of development experience with complex micro-services based applications/system.

Our minimum requirements for this role include;
A BS/CS/EE degree or technical equivalent in addition to 6+ years of distributed software development experience preferably in C++ / Java
Proficiency in a scripting language such as JavaScript, Unix shell for testing
You possess previous experience with RESTful API's, HTML, XML, JSON

Immuta was founded in 2015 based on a specific mission to build a platform that accelerates self-service access and control of sensitive data. Immuta’s award-winning automated data governance software platform creates trust across security, legal, compliance, and business teams so they can work together to ensure timely access to critical business data with minimal risks. Our automated, scalable, no code approach makes it easy for users to access the data they need, when they need it, while protecting sensitive data and ensuring their customers’ privacy.

Our Mission is clear. Enable the legal and ethical use of data. How we approach this mission is also clear!

We are mission focused. Born out of a government mission, we understand why data is about more than just analytics - it also represents our values. Our mission is to enable the legal and ethical use of data, ensuring that data is accessible to only those who need it, for the right reasons, and in the proper form.
We are humble intellects. We are experts in privacy, ethics, law, and engineering. But true expertise requires constant change - to always learn and to always adapt. And that means we excel as students and as teachers. We have something to learn from everyone, at any time, in any place.
We are independent achievers. We don’t need guidance to get things done, yet we know when to ask for help. We accomplish our mission while upholding our values, whatever it takes.
We are helpful and caring. For us, life is about the values we uphold, not the credit we receive or the attention we garner. We operate with respect and consideration of our peers, acting with empathy, honesty, transparency, and integrity.

APPLIED ENGINEERING TEAM
Immuta’s Applied Engineering team is a multi-functional engineering team responsible for product orchestration and packaging, application and integration development, and internal infrastructure automation services. They work closely with Immuta’s Product team to enhance the efficiency and security of the product’s deployment automation. Engineers on the team have an in-depth knowledge of the product and are able to build custom plugins and provide tier-2 customer support. They also build and maintain applications servicing customer’s inside and outside of Immuta. These applications include customer facing applications that are used to provide access to resources, as well as internal applications that power employee workflows. The members of this team are top-notch software and systems engineers who love building scalable & reliable software.

YOUR ROLE
Software Engineers on the Immuta Orchestration and Packaging team will work to improve the simplicity, efficiency, and security of the Immuta Data Platform. You will work with technologies, such as Kubernetes, to orchestrate a scalable deployment of a platform consisting of multiple discrete components. The applications, artifacts, and scripts that this team delivers will be utilized by customers deploying the Immuta Data Platform in their own infrastructure, as well as internally by other groups in the organization. They will also be used in Immuta’s cloud-based hosted deployments.

You will:
*Maintain application docker builds and build pipelines
*Work with our Information Security team on initiatives such as SOC-2 compliance
*Help to set up and maintain software vulnerability scanning policies and enforcement
*Orchestrate deployment of complex software packages
*Troubleshoot customer deployment trouble tickets

The software engineer will be responsible for ensuring that our software can be delivered efficiently and effectively, and that it maintains high standards of security. The ideal candidate will have a keen eye for detail, enjoys solving low-level technical problems, and has a strong desire to build highly effective solutions that streamline processes so we can keep improving.

WE'RE LOOKING FOR SOFTWARE ENGINEERS WHO…
*can tackle challenging problems with innovative thinking and determination
*have a deep understanding of at least one programming language and have a willingness / aptitude to learn more
*have excellent communication skills and can effectively discuss technical issues with both technical and non-technical individuals
*have a good understanding of Linux fundamentals
*have exposure to static and dynamic vulnerability scanning tools

TECHNOLOGIES YOU'LL USE
*Kubernetes
*Docker
*Linux
*PostgreSQL
*Bash
*CI/CD Pipelines
*Python, Go, Node.JS

Job Description:


At Fidelity Labs, we dont accept the status quo. Were debating, experimenting, researching, teaching, and collaborating on new ideas to help people live better financial lives. We have dedicated cross-functional incubator teams that operate like startups but have the backing and resources of Fidelity to ensure that we are able to focus on the things that matter. Using a combination of good old-fashioned ingenuity, and innovation methodologies such as Design Thinking and Lean Startup, our incubators take a customer-centric approach to problem solving, with a focus on rapid experimentation, and the permission to fail. See what were up to at FidelityLabs.com

Our software engineers play a key role on our incubator teams, making the ideas we research and refine through user testing come to life by building prototypes and iteratively evolving them into scalable products. Our incubator teams are empowered to move quickly and operate independently, so our engineers are involved in every step of the process from design through deployment. We believe strongly that it is our responsibility to continuously improve both as engineers and as a team every iteration so we write automated tests as part of our development workflow, practice pair programming, perform peer code reviews, and share knowledge in weekly tech talks. We use modern technologies and are always open to improving our tools and our process. The role is based in Durham, NC.

The Expertise Were Looking For
Bachelors degree Computer Science or other related discipline
Rapidly develop enterprise software based on requirement documents, prototypes, or verbal requirements
Learn and adopt new concepts & technologies quickly and implement them effectively in projects
Work across peer groups to resolve and understand complex technical/design issues.
Talent for writing clean, testable, readable, and easily maintainable code
Experience with middleware Java stack, Spring, messaging technologies and web containers
Experience with client side tech stack: HTML, CSS/SCSS, JavaScript, and Angular
Experience working in an Agile software delivery environment, with exposure to continuous integration and continuous delivery tools.
Understanding of fundamental design principles for building a scalable application
The Purpose of Your Role

Our software engineers play a key role on our incubator teams, making the ideas we research and refine through user testing come to life by building prototypes and iteratively evolving them into scalable products. Our incubator teams are empowered to move quickly and operate independently, so our engineers are involved in every step of the process from design through deployment. We believe strongly that it is our responsibility to continuously improve both as engineers and as a team every iteration so we write automated tests as part of our development workflow, practice pair programming, perform peer code reviews, and share knowledge in weekly tech talks. We use modern technologies and are always open to improving our tools and our process.

The Skills You Bring
We are looking for software engineers that are able to build high-quality, test-driven applications
Someone with deep knowledge of IT concepts, strategies, methodologies, and their application to business opportunities.
A proven track record of designing and building end-to-end systems client/server/db
Excellent knowledge of JavaScript, node, Express, Angular and Java although were open to strong developers with experience in other languages or frameworks and a desire to learn.
Expertise in various relational and no SQL database technologies
Someone who writes clean, maintainable code and refactors and improves the codebase as they add features to it
Experience being a mentor and builder of nimble and passionate teams.
Comfortable dealing with ambiguity and change
How Your Work Impacts the Organization

Fidelity Labs mission is to improve the financial lives of customers. Our approach is to identify important jobs to be done and then create business models that do them better than any other alternative. We are constantly scanning for ways to help customers. We then incubate those ideas from concept to scale. Fidelity Labs currently has a number of ventures at various stages in the pipeline - from deeply understanding the customers job to be done, to designing and experimenting to find product/market fit to pilot and scaling. The goal is to create sustainable new businesses that directly improve our customers financial lives.

Company Overview

At Fidelity, we are focused on making our financial expertise broadly accessible and effective in helping people live the lives they want. We are a privately held company that places a high degree of value in creating and nurturing a work environment that attracts the best talent and reflects our commitment to our associates. For information about working at Fidelity, visit FidelityCareers.com.

This opportunity is brought to you by Fidelity Labs.

About Osmose
With 85 years of experience, Osmose proudly serves the electric utility and telecommunications industries across the U.S., helping enable the delivery of safe, reliable and affordable electricity and communications services to millions of customers nationwide. We are the industry leader in wood and steel structure condition assessment, life-extension and rehabilitation services. Our mission is to accurately inspect and mitigate aging infrastructure in a planned, programmatic manner that minimizes owner costs while maximizing benefits.
Headquartered in Peachtree City, Georgia, with satellite offices in Atlanta, Buffalo-Depew, Syracuse, Boston-Westborough and Secaucus, NJ, the Osmose footprint extends throughout the country. Our employees are inspired to perform each and every day by our core values of integrity, customer focus, safety, respect, excellence, flexibility, efficiency and ownership. Our staff and field personnel represent some of the most tenured, well trained, and innovative professionals in the industry.
We are currently seeking a Software Engineer who will work closely with the Product Manager and development/test team to develop enhanced features based on structural engineering standards to an established structural analysis software product. The primary goal is to grow the product as the leading package into other market segments in the electric and communication utilities space and to grow the Technical Services profit center using the company's structural analysis software package.
This position can be based at our office in Syracuse, NY or from a home office if willing to travel to company facilities (primarily Syracuse) on a regular basis.
Responsibilities
Partner with the Software Development team to implement (design, write, debug, test, and document) new product functionality based on defined national and international structural analysis standards.
Develop expertise and serve as subject matter expert i the electric and communication utility structural analysis, design and maintenance including the strength and load aspect of wood, steel, concrete and fiberglass structures.
Develop expertise and serve as subject matter expert in national and international structural analysis standards as it relates to the electric and communication utility industry.
Work with the Product Manager, Software Development Team, and other internal teams (Engineering, Operations, etc.) to implement functionality that gives Osmose an advantage in our structural engineering and technical services.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or related engineering field with two (2) years of related experience preferred.
Excellent written and oral communication skills. Must be able to write technical documents using proper style and grammar.
Required knowledge of C# and SQL with demonstrated project experience utilizing these technologies. Experience in reporting and data presentation.
Strong working knowledge of structure engineering, physics and math disciplines.
Experience with national/international structure analysis standards a plus.
Experience in the utility industry is desirable.
Willingness to travel to Syracuse, NY and Peachtree City, GA office locations on a regular basis (25%) and customer, vendor, and industry meeting locations, as needed.
Benefits
Come grow with us! Full-time employees enjoy a comprehensive benefits package that includes:
Medical Insurance and Health Savings Account with company contribution
Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, STD, LTD, Critical Illness Plan and more!
401(k) with excellent company match
Paid time off

Senior Software Engineer works as part of an aggressive team, comprised of software engineers as well as machinery engineers involved with designing, developing, and testing complex software applications related to integration of real-time sensor based machinery predictive analytics with a transactional equipment information database, producing web based BI dash-board views.

Job Description:
We're looking for game changers. People who love what they do and who they do it for. Providing consulting services in operational support, intelligence collection, reporting, and data governance, R2C is a leader in delivering solutions for high priority national security concerns. Are you ready for a change?

R2C is seeking Software Engineers to support a client's technical requirements on a mission-focused program within a challenging, dynamic setting located in the Washington Metropolitan Area.
We welcome the most challenging problems facing our national security and apply intellect, talent, and innovation to reach feasible and valuable solutions to each challenge. That means we expect our employees to bring their “A game,” and you have the right to expect the same from the company that employs you. We want to hear your ideas. We want to hear your concerns. We want to make sure you have what you need to do the best you can on the job and grow in your career with us over time. Almost all companies say they have a culture of inclusiveness and that they value employee input, but R2C puts that statement to work every day. It’s time for a change. Come and experience a company that actually cares.

Top Secret/SCI w/ Polygraph
Design, develop, test, and deploy COTS and custom components for systems

Experience developing and deploying web-based applications on Tomcat and familiarity with JavaScript frameworks

Rudimentary knowledge of Linux and shell scripting

The Reports and Requirements Company, LLC (R2C) is a wholly owned subsidiary of Buchanan & Edwards, and provides consulting services in operational support, intelligence collection, reporting, and data governance. Located in Arlington, VA, R2C offers expertise on a variety of national security topics, with specific focus on operational support, technical operations, policies and management of large volumes of data, analysis of large amounts of data, & effective approaches to evaluating and sharing data, and innovative techniques for information collection. Our consultants develop and deliver training programs on subjects including cyber intelligence, data governance and information sharing protocols, intelligence collection, and reporting techniques. R2C has a mission first culture and boasts the benefits & perks of a small company with the resources, stability, and career mobility of a large corporation.
