Position Summary:

The Cyber Security Engineer applies an interdisciplinary, collaborative approach to help plan, design, develop, validate, and verify resilient cyber solutions across the product lifecycle. This role benefits from an analytical mindset and a detailed understanding of Cyber Security methodologies. The Cyber Security Engineer has an excellent understanding of technology infrastructures; entailing Routing/Switching, Firewalls, VPN, Data Loss Prevention, Intrusion Detection/Prevention, Web-Proxy, Behavior Analytics, End Point Detection/Response, and Security Audits. This position is part of a highly collaborative, driven team that works closely together to tackle everything from support to long term infrastructure and Cyber Security strategy planning, and offers the opportunity to participate in the technology strategy for the entire enterprise.

Essential Functions:

1. Responsible for practicing, supporting and promoting Graton Resort & Casino's Company-wide culture and demonstrating Graton Resort & Casino's Service Standards at all times.
2. Manage the day to day operations of the Graton vulnerability management and remediation program. Work with the systems and network engineering teams to execute vulnerability emediation.
3. Monitor alerts from Graton's cyber security dashboards, including using threat intelligence and
researching the security alerts to determine a course of action.
4. Execute cyber security tasks concerning IT projects to ensure a proper strategy develops from initial project planning.
5. Assist in managing the operations of the Cyber Security Awareness Training Program for the business. Plan and execute different campaigns and regular security training topics.
6. Continual development and improvement of cyber security policies, standards, procedures, and
guidelines for IT and the business.
7. Create, maintain and organize technical documentation for all property information systems.
8. Conduct cyber risk assessment activities, including threat modeling, vulnerability analysis, and analysis of mitigation solutions.
9. Assist to develop, evaluate and analyze design constraints, trade-offs, and detailed system and
security design pertaining to the cyber domain.
10. Conduct forensic investigations into incidents to understand the root cause and provide
recommendations on solutions. Document security breaches and assess the damage they cause.
11. Employ cyber security processes, methods, techniques, and tools and assure their consistent
application.
12. Respond to system and network security breaches. Troubleshoot security and network problems.
13. Ensure the organization's data and infrastructure are protected by helping to provide guidance and recommendations in enabling the appropriate security controls.
14. Participate in the change management process.
15. Stay current on cyber security trends and news to help continually develop company-wide best
practices for cyber security.
16. Research security vulnerabilities, enhancements, technologies and make recommendations to
management.

Required Qualifications:

1. Ability to communicate effectively with Guests, Team Members and Management in both written and verbal form.
2. Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution in a related STEM discipline (such as Computer
Science, Computer Engineering, Cybersecurity Engineering or Systems Engineering), or equivalent
experience/combined education.
3. Experience with both networking and security. Preferably with two (2) or more years of experience as a network engineer and then three (3) or more years of experience as a security engineer afterward.
4. Experience with a SIEM, vulnerability management and risk assessment, threat intelligence, and
behavioral -based systems for monitoring computer networks for security issues.
5. Experience with Gaming and PCI compliances and related processes.
6. Experience with investigating security breaches (and other incidents) as part of the overall incident response activities, and related forensics of Windows, Mac, iPhone, Android, and Linux based platforms to understand the root cause.
7. Experience with participating in projects from a security perspective to advise and guide secure project development and implementation in order to help colleagues gain greater understanding of information security management.
8. Experience in performing different types of scans to uncover system/network vulnerabilities and then fix detected vulnerabilities to maintain a high-security standard.
9. Experience in planning, implementing, managing, monitoring and upgrading security measures to protect the organization's data, systems and networks.
10. Experience with automation/scripting tools for security automation (PowerShell, Python, Bash, etc.) as part of SOAR activities.
11. The ability to work under pressure with minimal direction, in a fast-paced environment.
12. Strong attention to detail with an analytical mindset.
13. Understand patch management with the ability to deploy patches in a timely manner while
understanding business impact.
14. A desire to learn, grow and share knowledge in the cyber security domain.
15. Ability to work in a team environment, as well as independently, demonstrate excellent problem-solving skills, be well organized, flexible, and self-motivated. Communicate effectively with systems engineers, network engineers, and software developers (in both written and verbal form).

Physical Requirements:

1. Requires normal, corrective vision range, the ability to see color and the ability to distinguish letters, numbers and symbols.
2. Position requires after hours on-call availability (tier 2), daily work schedule.
3. Manual dexterity to operate job related equipment.
4. Ability to lift up to 50 pounds with or without assistance.

The Company
The world is facing a medical crisis, bacteria are increasingly evolving resistance to even our strongest antibiotics. The problem is already very real and immediate; for example, bloodstream infection leading to sepsis is now responsible for more than half of all deaths in hospitals and is the most expensive condition treated in hospitals. Sepsis mortality rate increases >6% every hour without effective antibiotic treatment. Yet, despite the life and death urgency, and healthcare cost impacts, current methodologies require 3 days to determine the correct antibiotic.
Specific Diagnostics has developed a breakthrough solution to rapidly determine the effective antibiotic treatment for bloodstream and other acute infections. Used for bloodstream infection Specific’s solution provides results 2 days sooner than existing methods, saving patients suffering from drug-resistant infection.
We have been funded by nearly $30 M in non-dilutive government sponsored research support and recently $17.5 M in venture capital. This is an opportunity to join us at an inflection point in our commercial growth as we bring our first key product to market and with recognition from major customers fueling an expansion of our staff.
The Job
his is the job for you if want to be where your ideas to be central to a world-changing and lifesaving product. Data science and analytics are at the core of our company we are seeking an exceptional talent to join our team. You will be a key contributor and critical to the success of the company. The main tasks you are expected to contribute to are:
Applying data transformation methods for processing high-volume, temporal high-dimensional data streams generated in real-time from our proprietary sensor technology.
The development of data-driven visualization tools for the explorative analysis of high-dimensional data.
The application and development of suitable pre-processing techniques to account for data errors and artifacts.
The development and validation of applications for a medical instrument built under the guidance of a senior manager experienced in the application development discipline (so you’ll be learning the valuable skill of integrating your work into applications for medical diagnostic devices).
Data pipeline and warehouse development and maintenance
This is not the job for a numbers only person. We want someone with a passion for and experience in the sciences that will lead you to look deeply into the sources of the data along with the scientists so that the data analysis is influenced by the science of our diagnostic technology and the science is influenced by the analysis.
You
You have a proven track record of successfully developing, validating and deploying data analysis methods to solve challenging real-world applications. You are deeply familiar with ETL tools, Python, and Pandas. You should have a track record of success in your education and projects and have these characteristics and skills:
Bachelor's degree in computer sciences, biomedical engineering, or related field and at least 2 years of interesting relevant experience.
Expert in Python & Pandas and proficient with Object Oriented Programming and test development.
Proficiency in SQL as well as NoSQL database technologies. Experience with Postgres and Snowflake preferred
AWS experience a strong plus
Comfortable with Linux and writing Bash scripts
Familiar with authoring on Tableau Desktop or Tableau Server
Full fluency (verbal and written) of the English language is a must.

Job Description
Building Engineer/Maintenance Technician - Facilities & Property Management
Summary:
A Building Engineer is responsible for maintaining the buildings and grounds of various commercial properties (retail, Class A office, multi-family, hospitality and general grounds). The candidate should have a strong background in HVAC, electrical and/or plumbing trades with a working knowledge of all main building components. Familiarity with repairs involving drywall, paint, door hardware and general carpentry is required. The position demands attention to detail and the ability to provide a superior customer service experience to tenants and customers. The candidate must be self-motivated and capable of working well with a team of Property Management staff.
Responsibilities:
Complies with all applicable codes, regulations, governmental agency and company directives related to building operations and work safety.
Operates, maintains, monitors, and performs preventive, predictive and corrective maintenance on building equipment, which may include: mechanical/HVAC/plumbing systems, electrical/cabling, fire detection and suppression, life safety, lighting, temperature control systems, building management systems and digital systems.
Maintains the professional appearances of the property, equipment, engineering spaces, and common areas.
Maintains the building lighting system, including element and ballast repairs or replacements. Familiarity with LED fixtures and drivers is a plus.
Prepares estimates detailing the amount of time and materials needed for completing tasks.
Maintains adequate supplies and tools and orders necessary materials to complete all tasks.
Maintains an energy management program to ensure measures are taken to operate all systems in the most efficient manner to keep operating costs at a minimum.
Oversees and inspects the work performed by outside contractors. Contracted work may include landscaping, cleaning, remodeling and major HVAC, plumbing and electrical items.
Performs work in compliance with standard operating procedures and/or critical work packages, along with all maintenance work instructions.
Performs specialized and complex work such as carpentry, electrical, painting, roofing, HVAC, furniture assembly/relocation and locksmith tasks.
Performs inspection of building systems including fire alarms, HVAC, plumbing and electrical.
Uses technology devices effectively including, a smart phone/tablet and PC for interaction with managers and service management software. Working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook is required. Prior experience with work order management systems is preferred.

Chesapeake Technology International (CTI) is a rapidly growing software, systems, and operational support corporation dedicated to providing user-focused technologies for military and other security applications including spectrum dependent operations (e.g. electronic warfare and signals intelligence), tactical & unmanned systems, C4ISR, and training & simulation capabilities. We believe in the power of collaborative development, and we are committed to engineering our solutions on open, government-owned platforms, ensuring that industry proprietary tools do not stand in the way of the right capabilities being employed on the battlefield.

We are looking for people who are intellectually curious, self-motivated, committed to excellence, and constantly seeking to learn and grow. Our typical toolset includes the Atlassian tool suite, Git, Gradle, IntelliJ, and Slack but we strive to use the best commercial, open source, or internally developed technologies for each problem. We work in small teams where each person is able to impact the technical direction of the project. At CTI, you will be exposed to a range of technologies and have opportunities to support a variety of unique projects in Java, Android, and/or various web technologies. Here are some examples of solutions we develop:
Real-time geospatial visualization of spectrum, including command and control of integrated platforms/sensors
Tools to collect, process, exploit, and disseminate large amounts of telemetry and sensor data
Immersive 3D scenario modeling for planning, analysis, and training
Open platform of APIs and services for desktop, mobile, and web applications to interface with devices such as radios and UAVs
If you thrive on solving challenging problems like these and desire to do so with a fun group of bright people, we want to hear from you!

Architect, design, develop, document, test, and debug new and existing software systems and applications
Participate as a primary voice in code reviews, constructively and humbly guiding/mentoring more junior developers

Analyze user needs to determine technical requirements
Write technical specifications based on conceptual design and stated business requirements
Identify and evaluate new technologies for implementation that improve the stability, performance, and quality of the multiple projects and teams.
Analyze code to find causes of errors/inefficiency and revise software as needed
Lead and mentor other engineers in meeting technical requirements

Initiative and the ability to work independently and collaborate within a team

Work with existing customers for optimization of EMS to achieve lowest operating and maintenance costs.
_ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS: _
_ _
40% Maintains high level of contact with customers to ensure complete customer satisfaction. Use high level understanding of commercial energy tariff’s to help customers understand how to utilize an EMS to reduce operating and maintenance costs. Create and present payback analysis to customers.
15% Continually monitor and evaluate engineering, project management, and subcontractor performance to ensure compliance with contract specifications. Monitor profit for each project and report deviations to Sales Manager.
15% Prepare technical quote and scope of work for customer projects using take off plans and specs.
15% Produces technical presentations on EMS applications and demonstrate product features to facility owners and engineers.
10% Provide technical resources to facility owners and engineers for design and specification of Energy Management Systems.
5% Work cooperatively with the PASCO team to complete projects.

If you are a current Motorola Solutions employee, please click this link to apply through your Workday account.
Company Overview
At Motorola Solutions, we create technologies our customers refer to as their lifeline. Our technology platforms in communications, software, video and services help our customers work safely and more efficiently. Whether it’s helping firefighters see through smoke, enabling police officers to see around street corners, or reliably keeping the lights on in homes and businesses around the world, our work supports those who put their lives on the line to keep us safe. Bring your passion, potential and talents to Motorola Solutions, and help us usher in a new era in public safety and security.

Department Overview
Motorola Solutions’ innovations, products and services play essential roles in people’s lives. Our end-to-end suite of software solutions helps our customers answer thousands of emergency calls and text messages, and process video, disparate evidence and records. We are also proud to be industry leaders in video security solutions installed in more than 120 countries at thousands of customer sites, including school campuses, transportation systems, healthcare centers, public venues, critical infrastructure, prisons, factories, casinos, airports, financial institutions, government facilities, and retailers.

Our products leverage cutting edge voice technology, language models, natural language understanding, video analytics, and Machine Learning (ML) to enable our customers to focus on what matters while providing faster responses, safer outcomes and greater transparency. The candidate will join a talented team of scientists and engineers (located in Chicago, Boston, Vancouver and Krakow, Poland) in the Chief Technology Office at Motorola Solutions working on developing mission-critical AI solutions for our public safety and commercial customers. Our mission is to provide meaningful value to MSI’s customers by developing domain-specific applications and services in the areas of Speech & Audio, Machine Translation, Natural Language Understanding and Computer Vision.

Our AI team is focused on all aspects of 1) designing, prototyping and developing solutions (algorithms and architectures for object detection, classification etc.), 2) Machine Learning training and optimization (distributed training and inference acceleration) and 3) data (tools for data acquisition, annotation – both human and machine-powered, data pipelines and supporting ML infrastructure). We’re excited about the work we are doing in AI. We often describe it as “Mission Critical AI” because our approach is founded on our many years of Public Safety and Video Security experience and knowledge. We know the mission-critical needs of our customers are unique and different from the most consumer technologies that leverage AI today.

Job Description
Contribute to and extend our distributed ML inference platform for video utilizing programming skills in C/C++ and Python.
Develop modular, distributed applications which scale across dozens of servers and hundreds of GPUs.
Build libraries and frameworks that support, operationalize and productize machine learning workflows for use both in product and by internal teams.
Develop and maintain key backend components and APIs.
Analyze field data in order to identify areas of possible improvement or enhancement of the system.
Present and discuss ideas and results within the team and with internal stakeholders (product/project management, engineering etc.).
Required Skills:
Bachelor/Masters degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a relevant field
Strong programming, debugging and problem solving skills (Python, C/C++, Go)
3+ years experience with OO design and common design patterns
3+ years experience with data structures, algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis
Hands-on development of distributed system features and/or cloud scale services, and RESTful web services
Experience with UNIX/Linux and basic knowledge of networking fundamentals
Dependable written and oral communication skills
Desired Skills:
Experience with Docker and/or Kubernetes
Experience with image and/or video processing (e.g., open source software projects such as Gstreamer and FFmpeg).
Background in parallel processing, CUDA, use of GPUs in image processing, and performance profiling
Activity in the Open Source community (e.g., github account as reference) is a strong plus.

Basic Requirements
Bachelor/Masters degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a relevant field

MaXentric Technologies LLC, a provider of wireless technology solutions, products, and services for commercial and military applications, has a full-time engineering position opening with the potential for growth. Targeted for candidates with Bachelors or Masters degree with >5-10 years of experience in Power Amplifier design and linearization techniques. The position is available at our San Diego office (La Jolla, CA).  The ideal candidate will be an excellent problem solver with a great attention to details who is proud of their own work and can meet project deadlines. We are looking for a candidate with innovative and energetic personality who is willing to explore new ideas. The candidate must be a strong team player with excellent communication skills.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES
As part of your ESSENTIAL DUTIES of this position, you will:
Contribute in PA testing and verification in support of hardware development for advanced RF and wireless communications systems
Contribute integration of circuits and sub-assemblies into the top-level system
Implement design verification test plans at top level.
Implement design verification test plans at system level.
Maintain knowledge of current technical advancements in the general field of RF/microwave electronics by keeping up with current developments and trends in area of expertise.
Generate novel and unique solutions to technical challenges including, but not limited to circuit, device, communication system architecture, and advance transceiver design.
Required Skills:
Measurement of GaN/GaAs Power Amplifiers in hybrid and MMIC form
Experience in analog and digital linearization techniques.
RF/Microwave lab skills with, but not limited to spectrum analyzer, network analyzer, power meter, arbitrary waveform generator, oscilloscope, multi-meter, synthesizer, etc.
Demonstrated knowledge of RF/microwave networks and transceiver architectures.
Ability to analyze and solve highly complex technical problems quickly and independently.
Proven capability to give meaningful presentations and communicate effectively with design teams and professional customers while clearly convey information.
Knowledge of / Emphasis / Experience in at least 2 of the following:
Electronic design in one of the following specialties: RF/Analog circuit design or power conversion circuit design.
Electrical concepts pertaining wireless communication transmitter and receiver line-ups.
Mechanical concepts pertaining to RF power circuits.
Wireless communication systems.
Control and communication theory.
Experience with at least 3 of the following CAD/Simulation/Software tools:
Matlab and SimuLink
Keysight ADS or AWR Microwave Office
Keysight SystemVue or AWR VSS
National Instruments LabView
Cadence Analog Environment or RFSpectre
PSPICE or LTSPiCE
Work well in collaborative environment.
Strong interpersonal skills.

Limited travel to prime contractor development facilities may be required.

Education:

Background in C, C++, C#, Ada
Experience with code level IV&V

Prior demonstrated experience with software architecture, systems engineering, software integration, and verification and validation.
Prior demonstrated experience in test analysis, test witnessing, test planning.
Experience in programs - GMD and domain knowledge of Ground Based Interceptor systems (payload or booster).
Past software development experience with Ballistic Missile Defense Systems or Missile Booster Software.
Experience with development of unit and/or integration level tests and verification of source code test results against requirements.

About A-P-T Research
A-P-T Research, Inc., is an engineering services company with employees who combine excellence in their disciplines with enthusiasm, versatility, and willingness to “pitch in” wherever needed to support customers, and to perform the many functions of a small company. Employees share ownership in the company and participate in corporate planning and operation. We are both motivated and empowered to provide optimum, flexible support to customers.
Since APT’s incorporation in June 1990, the officers have carefully and deliberately built the company’s strong technical and administrative infrastructure. Experienced engineers have been chosen to lead project areas, policies and procedures have been developed to address the diverse aspects of contracting and administration, and support personnel have been selected to fill specialty roles. APT proudly continues to provide top-quality services to satisfied and loyal customers.
APT is an employee-owned company specializing in conducting safety analyses for the U.S. Government. APT offers competitive salaries, advancement opportunities, and excellent benefits.
APT Research is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer – Minorities/Female/Disabled/Veterans. Job Title: Principal Software Engineer - Java - Pleasanton Hub
Job Description:
Our engineering and product teams are organized around our hubs for community and collaboration. Work anywhere means you can work at home or the office on any given day. Your product hub is based on the primary location of your product. You should live within one timezone of your product hub. Our current product hubs are Pleasanton, Columbus, Boston, NYC, Raleigh, and Toronto.

We are looking for Principal Software Engineers that are self-starters, love solving technical challenges, and have prior experience working on a variety of engineering projects in an energizing environment. You should have expertise in Java applications and extensive experience working with the latest open source technologies. In this role, you will be focused on building software that can scale and continue to evolve with new features and capabilities over time.
What You'll Do
Collaborate with Product Management and Development team members on technical design and problem solving to come up with compelling solutions to problems.
Use a pragmatic Test Driven Development approach to developing high-quality software that doesn't need to be assured by a QA team before it's deployed to production.
Own all aspects of implementation for features from design to development, deployment to production, and support and maintenance.
Mentor junior engineers
Requirements
8+ years of software development experience
Extensive experience with Solr and Lucene
Extensive experience developing enterprise software in Java
Hands-on development experience with current open source tools and technologies (Java, Spring, MySQL, Hibernate, Maven, Git, Jenkins, JUnit, Mockito, Log4J, AspectJ, Tomcat, JMS, Linux)
Deep expertise in object-oriented design and implementation
Drive and flexibility to roll up your sleeves and work hard (and have fun) in a fast-moving startup environment

Veeva builds enterprise cloud technology that powers the biggest names in the pharmaceutical, biotech, consumer goods, chemical & cosmetics industries.
